title: The Algorithmic Class Divide
description: How redlining turned into algorithmic bias. Exploring the historical roots of discriminatory lending practices and their modern AI-powered manifestations in credit scoring and mortgage approval systems.

title: Investing in Liberation: AI as a Tool for Economic Justice
description: Can machine learning models be used to identify and fund underserved communities? A conversation about using AI to democratize access to capital.
guest: Data scientist + community investment fund director

title: The Ghost in the Machine: Bias Audits for Financial AI
description: Deep dive into fairness testing frameworks, intersectional bias detection, and the regulatory landscape for AI in finance.
guest: Fair lending compliance expert + ML researcher

title: Decolonizing Data: Who Owns the Training Sets?
description: Examining data extraction, consent, and ownership in AI systems used for credit and risk assessment in the Global South.

title: From Payday Loans to Prediction Markets: AI and Financial Predation
description: How AI-powered fintech can either exploit or empower vulnerable populations. Case studies from predatory lending detection systems.
